review_title: You don't get the highs without the lows
pros: At Hampshire, faculty are encouraged to teach what they want. It doesn't matter if the material crosses disciplinary boundaries or seems way out there, all that matters is that you're passionate about it. That passion, they believe, translates into the students. And it's true. Students know when you're regurgitating old material with little interest, just like they know when you're pushing the boundaries of knowledge with a gleam in your eye. It is liberating. It is empowering. It is rather unique in higher education.
cons: Hampshire is under-funded. So all of your innovation, all of your experimentation, will need to happen on a shoestring budget. If you can make it happen then it will happen. But don't expect a lot of financial support from the school in your quest. Find the funds elsewhere - grants, contributions, partnerships, etc.
